findings.title: RES - Redundant Event Statement
findings.description: The `_changeThreshold` event statement is not used in the contract's implementation.

findings.title: RSW - Redundant Storage Writes
findings.description: The contract updates state variables even if its current state is the same as the one passed as an argument, resulting in redundant storage writes.

findings.title: PAV - Pair Address Validation
findings.description: The contract lacks address validation in the pair address argument, which can introduce security risks and potential attacks.

findings.title: FSA - Fixed Swap Address
findings.description: The swap address is assigned once and it cannot be changed. It is a common practice in decentralized exchanges to create new swap versions. A contract that cannot change the swap address may not be able to catch up to the upgrade.

findings.title: RCS - Redundant Conditional Statement
findings.description: The variable `_totalSupply` is initialized on the contract's constructor, which means its value is always greater than zero. Hence, the conditional statement is redundant.

findings.title: UFM - Unused Fee/Swap Mechanism
findings.description: The contract's fees are set to zero and are immutable. While the contract declares variables and functions related to the fee and swap mechanism, these mechanisms are not utilized within the transaction flow.

findings.title: MEE - Missing Events Emission
findings.description: The contract performs actions and state mutations from external methods that do not result in the emission of events.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract declares state variables that their value is initialized once in the constructor and are not modified afterwards.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The Solidity style guide recommends following certain naming conventions to improve code readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can make a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and can also increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.

findings.title: L16 - Validate Variable Setters
findings.description: The contract performs operations on variables configured from user-supplied input without proper checks for zero values, leading to potential problems during execution.
